# Snowplow's dbt example project - custom event table unified

The purpose of this project is to show how you could use Snowplow's Unified Digital dbt package found in dbt's [package hub](https://hub.getdbt.com/snowplow/snowplow_unified/latest) in your existing dbt project. Specifically, this project shows how you could implement a custom app_errors derived table instead of the optional module the package provides. For more information please feel free to browse our [docs][docs] to get a better understanding of how our individual dbt packages work.

## Usage

You can see the package is only referenced under packages.yml and never directly overwritten. Forking the package means that you will not get the benefits of future releases which might contain features or bug fixes you would then not benefit from.

After that you can see how you can customize the project.yml file to overwrite package variable defaults or add additional configurations in preparation for your custom models. We added comments where necessary.

You can also see how you would overwrite the default_channel_group() dispatch macro so that it gets prioritized when your run your snowplow_unified_sessions table to create the default_channel_group field.

Finally, you can see how a custom app_errors module is constructed. In this implementation we built the next layer of drop and recompute this_run table to extract relevant fields from self describing events/ entities from your events table and filtered on specific events that are needed for the derived incremental table that will be built on top of that. In the incremental table we just select * from that this_run table. Additional comments have been added to show the most important things to know about it.

Once you set your custom derived implementation locally, we encourage you to run it against your dev target with a limited data by setting the backfill_limit_days variable to 1. Then run it at least twice and see the output both for a standard run and for an incremental run, both in the target warehouse itself and within your project under the target folder, where dbt will compile you the sql that took place in a given run.

# Join the Snowplow community

We welcome all ideas, questions and contributions!

For support requests, please use our community support [Discourse][discourse] forum.

If you find a bug, please report an issue on GitHub.
